str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To looked upon, regarded. And other moods and persons of the same tense; from epi and eido; to regard.
To take away, smite off. From apo and haireomai; to remove.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Reproach, disgrace. Probably akin to the base of onoma; notoriety, i.e. A taunt.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
